etymologies: early 16th century: apparently the plural of the obsolete noun odd ‘odd number or odd person’

definitions: the ratio between the amounts staked by the parties to a bet, based on the expected probability either way

examples.text: the bookies are offering odds of 8-1
it is possible for the race to be won at very long odds

shortDefinitions: ratio between amounts staked in bet

definitions: the chances or likelihood of something happening or being the case

examples.text: the odds are that he is no longer alive
the odds against this ever happening are high

constructions.text: the odds were in favor of

definitions: superiority in strength, power, or resources; advantage

examples.text: she clung to the lead against all the odds
the odds were overwhelmingly in favor of the banks rather than the customer
